title: How to Play Windows 95 Games on a Windows XP

steps.headline: If you have had Windows XP for a long time, Clean it up!
steps.description: If you have a laptop, it's different than regular computers. On the right side of the laptop, press the disc eject button and then it will open it up! For computers, There might be  be a disc drive on the front or side of your PC tower. Press the button to open it up.

steps.headline: Make sure the disc drive and the disc are clean.
steps.description: Old games can be dusty if they've sat around for a long time. Make sure you wipe the disc to remove the dust and damage on it so it will be clean and your computer will be able to read it!

steps.headline: Put the game disc in, For people who have laptops, Press the button on the right or left hand side (depending on the model) and it will open up.
steps.description: For desktops, You may have a disc drive on the front or side of your tower as mentioned previously. Press the button on the front and then it will open it up. Put the game disc in and shut it!

steps.headline: The game will work, It has old graphics but it will still be fun and maybe even nostalgic for you.
steps.description: Some examples of classic games for pc are SimCity 2000, Toy Story etc. Enjoy!

steps.headline: Have fun, Playing a nice old game should do the trick!
steps.description: If it's a game on the very first version of Windows, It won't work. It will go back to your desktop. You may wish to sell it to a collector of retro games or to try to emulate the DOS system in an application called DOS box. (See instructions below).

steps.headline: Alternatively, use a tool like DOS box.
Alternatively, find the .exe file of the game.
Right click on the file and choose "Properties"
Put a check in front of the "Run this program in compatibility mode for" option.
Select Windows 95 from the dropdown list, and click apply.

tyn: A Windows XP (required, mostly work on the previous Windows versions).
text: If you have had Windows XP for a long time, Clean it up! If you have a laptop, it's different than regular computers. On the right side of the laptop, press the disc eject button and then it will open it up! For computers, There might be  be a disc drive on the front or side of your PC tower. Press the button to open it up. Make sure the disc drive and the disc are clean. Old games can be dusty if they've sat around for a long time. Make sure you wipe the disc to remove the dust and damage on it so it will be clean and your computer will be able to read it! Put the game disc in, For people who have laptops, Press the button on the right or left hand side (depending on the model) and it will open up. For desktops, You may have a disc drive on the front or side of your tower as mentioned previously. Press the button on the front and then it will open it up. Put the game disc in and shut it! The game will work, It has old graphics but it will still be fun and maybe even nostalgic for you. Some examples of classic games for pc are SimCity 2000, Toy Story etc. Enjoy! Have fun, Playing a nice old game should do the trick! If it's a game on the very first version of Windows, It won't work. It will go back to your desktop. You may wish to sell it to a collector of retro games or to try to emulate the DOS system in an application called DOS box. (See instructions below). Alternatively, use a tool like DOS box.  Alternatively, find the .exe file of the game.  Right click on the file and choose "Properties"  Click on the "Compatibility Tab."  Put a check in front of the "Run this program in compatibility mode for" option.  Select Windows 95 from the dropdown list, and click apply.

If you have a laptop, it's different than regular computers.
On the right side of the laptop, press the disc eject button and then it will open it up!
For computers, There might be  be a disc drive on the front or side of your PC tower.
Press the button to open it up.
Make sure the disc drive and the disc are clean.
Old games can be dusty if they've sat around for a long time.
Make sure you wipe the disc to remove the dust and damage on it so it will be clean and your computer will be able to read it!
Put the game disc in, For people who have laptops, Press the button on the right or left hand side (depending on the model) and it will open up.
For desktops, You may have a disc drive on the front or side of your tower as mentioned previously.
Press the button on the front and then it will open it up.
Put the game disc in and shut it!
The game will work, It has old graphics but it will still be fun and maybe even nostalgic for you.
Some examples of classic games for pc are SimCity 2000, Toy Story etc.
Enjoy!
Have fun, Playing a nice old game should do the trick!
If it's a game on the very first version of Windows, It won't work.
It will go back to your desktop.
You may wish to sell it to a collector of retro games or to try to emulate the DOS system in an application called DOS box.
(See instructions below).
Alternatively, use a tool like DOS box.
Alternatively, find the .exe file of the game.
Right click on the file and choose "Properties"  Click on the "Compatibility Tab."
Put a check in front of the "Run this program in compatibility mode for" option.
Select Windows 95 from the dropdown list, and click apply.
